Withdraws awkwardly when caught by parents, showing vulnerability but no negative behavior.
Questions Officer Cole about Officer Mackey, showing curiosity and willingness to engage with authority figures despite peer pressure.
Ignores peers' warning to shut up and persists in asking questions.
Reacts with alarm upon hearing about a missing kid and canceled block party, indicating situational awareness.
Responds immediately to walkie talkie signal by bolting upstairs and engaging in surveillance with binoculars, demonstrating initiative and proactive behavior.
Follows Randall's orders only after being prompted, showing some lack of self-discipline in tidying up.
Admits he loves hanging out with Nikki as friends and demonstrates sincere concern for her safety.
Insists on spying on Mackey despite warnings, showing stubbornness that could endanger himself and others.
Shares a secret and trustingly confides his fears and suspicions to Nikki.
Defends Nikki against crude sexual comments by his friends.
Expresses care and concern for the people in his neighborhood.
Focuses on the group's goal and tries to keep everyone on track.
Initiates a plan to use old G.I. Joe walkie-talkies for audio surveillance during a game of Manhunt, showing creativity and foresight.
Acts eagerly and confidently to organize the night's game, displaying leadership and planning skills.
Has a messy room and momentarily seems overwhelmed by his environment.
Attempts to sneak and overhear Mackey digging; freezes in disbelief rather than taking immediate action.
Maintains composure and fakes laughter to mask fear or unease during interaction with Mackey.
Scrambles quickly and successfully turns off the walkie-talkie feedback noise, stopping the disturbance.
Reluctantly accepts a small payment from Mackey despite feeling uneasy; shows caution but no assertiveness.
Politely declines Mackey's offer to come inside, demonstrating awareness and self-control not to get involved further.
Organizes the group to meet and share information about Mackey's schedule, showing leadership and reliance on his friends.
Keeps a vigilant overnight watch on Mackey's house out of suspicion, revealing mistrust toward Mackey.
Shares discovery of the bloody shirt with friends to warn them.
Dismisses disgust about the shirt when tossing it on the counter, showing practical concern over feelings.
Quickly researches Sodium Hydroxide to understand its use, shares the information with friends to inform them about the danger.
Decides to tell his worried parents about the hazardous find, demonstrating responsibility and trustworthiness.
Urgently tries to convince his parents of the danger posed by Mackey and insists they must act to save people.
Leads and participates in spying, vandalizing, and digging up property to uncover the truth.
Takes responsibility to confess vandalism to Mackey and apologizes sincerely despite pressure and risk.
Feels isolated and unsupported by friends when confessing the truth.
Accuses Mackey of being a killer based on suspicion without proof.
Persistently wants to gather real evidence despite friends giving up on the cop theory
Looks imploringly at Farraday, showing vulnerability and seeking support
Smiles in success after quietly unlocking his padlock, showing resourcefulness without boasting
Answers Nikki’s late-night call promptly and shows concern for her situation
Observes and appreciates Nikki’s room without disrespect or rudeness
Apologizes for a mistake and takes responsibility, promising to fix the problem.
Locks the door and sneaks out to continue investigation despite being grounded.
Effectively uses the phone operator to get the last dialed number from the house.
Quickly recognizes the significance of the phone number and connects it to Mackey.
Tries to rally friends and logically present the evidence showing guilt.
Ignores friends' warnings about the risk involved.
Prepares cautiously by instructing friends to stay quiet and arming himself with a walkie-talkie.
Offers to alert others to help someone climb out the window to avoid being caught.
Watches the news in stunned silence, showing concern and empathy for the community but does not openly express it.
Clips his walkie to his belt and uses it to discreetly listen and communicate during a tense situation.
Reacts with stunned silence and disbelief upon seeing the news about the arrest, showing momentary shock but maintaining composure.
Looks on with empathy at Bobby Coker being reunited with his parents, takes a deep breath reflecting on the situation, shows humility when Nikki credits him for positive change
Responds modestly to Nikki's thanks, unsure about taking credit, open to emotional connection as shown by his stunned but happy response to Nikki's kiss
Wakes Woody up and insists on untying him first, then helps untie himself; tries to protect and aid Woody despite danger
Despite severe leg injury and intense pain, drags himself toward the squad car and keeps urging himself forward, showing physical and mental endurance.
Collapses and sobs when confronted and threatened, visibly overwhelmed by fear, indicating emotional vulnerability and momentary loss of composure.
Maintains eye contact with Mackey despite extreme fear, showing some presence of mind and engagement in the confrontation.
Makes a calm, reflective observation about the contrast between appearances and hidden dangers ('Even serial killers live next door to somebody...')
